intro: Bathmium undulatum, commonly known as the wavy bathmium, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its unique, undulating leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of pink and white, which bloom during the cooler months. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it well adapted to its harsh environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Bathmium undulatum is considered a vulnerable species.
